preprocess_consensus module¶

preprocess_consensus.archive_consensus(year, month, date, hour)¶

Pulls relay info from consensus file helper for pickle_consensus, read in raw consensus file from archive folder and return a list of relay object with basic info assigned

Parameters

  • year – (str) year of the consensus file

  • month – (str) month of consensus file

  • date – (str) date of consensus file

  • hour – (str) hr of consensus file

Returns

(list) list of Relay objects, (int) wgd, (int), wgg

preprocess_consensus.coverage_dict(roas, ipv4s, ipv6s, make_pickle=False)¶

use roa file to check against ipv4 and ipv6 addresses to see if that relay is covered by roa make a new dict mapping ip address to its ROA coverage info, ip -> [ipv4, maxlen, prefixlen, asn]

Parameters

  • roas – (string) filename of the roa data

  • ipv4s – (list) list of ipv4s to check roa coverage

  • ipv6s – (list) list of ipv6s to check roa coverage

  • make_pickle – (boolean) if true, make pickle of the resulting dictionary (ip -> [ipv4, maxlen, prefixlen, asn]) into pick

Returns

2 dictionaries for ipv4 and ipv6 in ip -> [ipv4, maxlen, prefixlen, asn] format

preprocess_consensus.get_all_ips(start_date, end_date)¶

go through all archive_pickles files in a time span get the ip address of all relays

Parameters

  • start_date – (datetime object) start of the duration

  • end_date – (datetime object) end of the duration

Returns

the set of all ipv4 and ipv6 addresses

preprocess_consensus.get_pre_asn(ipv4s, ipv6s, make_pickle=False, existing_file=False)¶

takes in list of ip addresses and find the corresponding ASN and ip prefix for each address. Each ip address is map to a list with ASN and prefix

Parameters

  • ipv4s – (list) list of ipv4 addresses

  • ipv6s – (list) list of ipv6 addresses

Make_pickle

(boolean) make pickle containing ip -> [prefix, ASN] dictionary if true

Existing_file

(boolean) use previous pickle to save runtime for repeating ip addresses

Returns

2 dictionaries for ipv4 and ipv6, each containing ip -> [prefix, ASN]

preprocess_consensus.get_prefix_and_asn_local(ip)¶

wrapper function to get prefix and ASN given an ip address

Parameters

ip – (str) ip address in string

Returns

ip prefix in ipaddress module object, ASN

preprocess_consensus.get_roas(filename)¶

parse roa file in .csv format, put each entry in a list, then append to a list containing all entries. each line in the file converts into [ipv4, maxlen, prefixlen, asn]

Parameters

filename – (string) name of the csv file to parse

Returns

2 lists of list for ipv4 and ipv6 addresses, entry in each list is [ipv4, maxlen, prefixlen, asn]

preprocess_consensus.load_consensus(p, year, month, date, hour)¶

pulls list of relay object, weight info (wgd, wgg) from pickled file :param p: (str) path of pickle directory :param year: (str) year of the consensus :param month: (str) month of the consensus :param date: (str) date of the consensus :param hour: (str) hour of the consensus

Returns

list of relay objects, wgd, wgg

preprocess_consensus.main(args)¶

sample usage: python3 preprocess_consensus.py 2021-03-13-00 2021-03-13-01 20210313.csv Put raw consensus file into archive folder, this main function will make relay objects and pickle them in archive_pickles folder The relay objects with ROA coverage and ip, asn information will be placed in the processed folder

preprocess_consensus.parse_arguments(args)¶
preprocess_consensus.pickle_consensus(start_date, end_date, gen_all_ip_pickles=False)¶

call archive_consensus to get a list of relay objects, pickle and move them into archive_pickles folder :param start_date: (datetime object) start of the duration :param end_date: (datetime object) end of the duration :param gen_all_ip_pickles: (boolean) produce pickle with all ip addresses if true

Returns

set of IPv4 and IPv6 addresses if gen_all_ip_pickles true, else return None

preprocess_consensus.update_consensus_pickle(start_date, end_date, v4coverage, v6coverage, ipv4_asns, ipv6_asns)¶

update pickle in archive_pickles folder to contain ROA coverage and assign prefix and ASN

Parameters

  • start_date – (str) start date of the duration in needs update

  • end_date – (str) end date of the duration in need of update

  • v4coverage – (dict) input the result of coverage_dict function, mapping ip -> ROA info

  • v6coverage – (dict) input the result of coverage_dict function, mapping ip -> ROA info

  • ipv4_asns – (dict) input result from get_pre_asn, ip -> [prefix, ASN]

  • ipv6_asns – (dict) input result from get_pre_asn, ip -> [prefix, ASN]
